paper_title: One-step in-situ synthesis of porous Fe3+-doped TiO2 octahedra toward visible-light photocatalytic conversion of CO2 into solar fuel

catalyst.source: One-step in-situ synthesis of porous Fe3+-doped TiO2 octahedra toward visible-light photocatalytic conversion of CO2 into solar fuel
catalyst.context: One-step in-situ synthesis of porous Fe3+-doped TiO2 octahedra toward visible-light photocatalytic conversion of CO2 into solar fuel

catalyst.source: In order to remove residual MIL-101 and organic solvents before the CO 2 reduction cycle starts, Fe-TiO 2 was calcined at 500 C in air atmosphere for 6 h, the resultant product was named as Fe-TiO 2 -500.
catalyst.context: Synthesis of MIL-101(Fe): FeCl 3 6H 2 O (0.5 g) and terephthalic acid (0.15 g) were dissolved in DMF (12 mL).The resulting suspension was dispersed by ultrasound, then moved to a Teflon autoclave liner, and heated at 130 C for 24 h.The products were collected by centrifugation at 10,000 rpm for 2 min, washed with DMF and ethanol three times.Finally, the synthesized MIL-101(Fe) was dried overnight at 60 C. Synthesis of Fe-TiO 2 , Fe-TiO 2 -500 and pure TiO 2 : MIL-101(Fe) (5.0 mg) was dissolved in ethanol (10 mL), followed by adding tetrabutyl titanate (50 L) into the solution.The mixture was dispersed homogeneously by magnetic stirring for 20 min.Subsequently, 700 L of deionized water and 20 L of HF were mixed with constantly stirring for 10 min.Finally, it was transferred into a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel autoclave and heated for 20 h at 180 C. The sample was separated from the solution by centrifugation and washed with deionized water and absolute ethanol repeatedly, then dried under vacuum at 60 C for 24 h.The obtained powder was named as Fe-TiO 2 .In order to remove residual MIL-101 and organic solvents before the CO 2 reduction cycle starts, Fe-TiO 2 was calcined at 500 C in air atmosphere for 6 h, the resultant product was named as Fe-TiO 2 -500.The synthesis of pure TiO nanoparticles is very similar to that of Fe-TiO 2 , except the remove of MIL-101(Fe) (5.0 mg).

catalyst.source: At last, the Fe-TiO 2 -500 octahedra show excellent photocatalytic activity, and the yield of CH 4 is about 7.73 mol g -1 after loading of Pt within 12 h of reaction time under visible light illumination.
catalyst.context: In summary, Fe 3 doped TiO 2 (Fe-TiO 2 ) octahedra were successfully prepared by a one-step hydrothermal method, using MIL-101(Fe) both as the template and the iron ion source.The formation of TiO 2 and the etching of MIL-101(Fe) occur simultaneously driven by fluorine ion.The obtained Fe-TiO 2 show uniformly Fe doping with a high specific surface area before and after the heat treatment (Fe-TiO 2 : 274 m 2 g -1 , Fe-TiO 2 -500:202 m 2 g -1 ).At last, the Fe-TiO 2 -500 octahedra show excellent photocatalytic activity, and the yield of CH 4 is about 7.73 mol g -1 after loading of Pt within 12 h of reaction time under visible light illumination.This work provides a convenient way for designing and preparing novel mental doped nanomaterials with high photocatalytic properties. Miao Xu: Writing -original draft, preparation.Heng wu: Investigation.Yawen Tang: Investigation.Guobing Mao: Methodology, Writing -review editing.Gang Wang: Project administration.Li Zhang: Funding acquisition.Qi Liu: Conceptualization, Supervision. The authors declare that they have no known competing financial interests or personal relationships that could have appeared to influence the work reported in this paper. Supplementary data to this article can be found online at https://doi. org/10.1016/j.micromeso.2020.110539.

co-catalyst.source: The yield of CH 4 is about 7.73 mol g -1 after loading of Pt within 12 h of reaction time under visible light illumination ( 420 nm).
co-catalyst.context: Here, hollow Fe 3 doped TiO 2 (Fe-TiO 2 ) octahedra were obtained via one-step hydrothermal method with MIL-101(Fe) as the template as well as the iron ion source.By introducing Ti precursor onto MIL-101(Fe) followed by HF etching and hydrothermal treatment, Fe-doped TiO 2 with high porosity and hollow structure was obtained.The as-synthesized Fe-TiO 2 octahedra consist of numerous small nanoparticles with particle sizes between 10 and 20 nm and possess a high specific surface area of 275 m 2 g -1 together with uniform mesopores of 3.7 nm in pore diameter.After heat treatment in air at 500 C (named Fe-TiO 2 -500), the BET surface area and the mesopore size of the sample were changed to 202 m 2 g -1 and 3.9 nm, respectively.Compared to other Fe-doping methods, this method reported here favors better and more uniform Fe doping into the TiO 2 lattice and improves the porosity and specific surface area.As a result of the Fe doping, the bandgaps of Fe-TiO 2 and Fe-TiO 2 -500 were about 2.75 eV and 2.42 eV, respectively.Fe-TiO 2 -500 shows excellent photocatalytic activity due to its special structure, high BET surface area and porosity.The yield of CH 4 is about 7.73 mol g -1 after loading of Pt within 12 h of reaction time under visible light illumination ( 420 nm).

co-catalyst.source: At last, the Fe-TiO 2 -500 octahedra show excellent photocatalytic activity, and the yield of CH 4 is about 7.73 mol g -1 after loading of Pt within 12 h of reaction time under visible light illumination.
co-catalyst.context: In summary, Fe 3 doped TiO 2 (Fe-TiO 2 ) octahedra were successfully prepared by a one-step hydrothermal method, using MIL-101(Fe) both as the template and the iron ion source.The formation of TiO 2 and the etching of MIL-101(Fe) occur simultaneously driven by fluorine ion.The obtained Fe-TiO 2 show uniformly Fe doping with a high specific surface area before and after the heat treatment (Fe-TiO 2 : 274 m 2 g -1 , Fe-TiO 2 -500:202 m 2 g -1 ).At last, the Fe-TiO 2 -500 octahedra show excellent photocatalytic activity, and the yield of CH 4 is about 7.73 mol g -1 after loading of Pt within 12 h of reaction time under visible light illumination.This work provides a convenient way for designing and preparing novel mental doped nanomaterials with high photocatalytic properties. Miao Xu: Writing -original draft, preparation.Heng wu: Investigation.Yawen Tang: Investigation.Guobing Mao: Methodology, Writing -review editing.Gang Wang: Project administration.Li Zhang: Funding acquisition.Qi Liu: Conceptualization, Supervision. The authors declare that they have no known competing financial interests or personal relationships that could have appeared to influence the work reported in this paper. Supplementary data to this article can be found online at https://doi. org/10.1016/j.micromeso.2020.110539.

light source.source: The yield of CH 4 is about 7.73 mol g -1 after loading of Pt within 12 h of reaction time under visible light illumination ( 420 nm).
light source.context: Here, hollow Fe 3 doped TiO 2 (Fe-TiO 2 ) octahedra were obtained via one-step hydrothermal method with MIL-101(Fe) as the template as well as the iron ion source.By introducing Ti precursor onto MIL-101(Fe) followed by HF etching and hydrothermal treatment, Fe-doped TiO 2 with high porosity and hollow structure was obtained.The as-synthesized Fe-TiO 2 octahedra consist of numerous small nanoparticles with particle sizes between 10 and 20 nm and possess a high specific surface area of 275 m 2 g -1 together with uniform mesopores of 3.7 nm in pore diameter.After heat treatment in air at 500 C (named Fe-TiO 2 -500), the BET surface area and the mesopore size of the sample were changed to 202 m 2 g -1 and 3.9 nm, respectively.Compared to other Fe-doping methods, this method reported here favors better and more uniform Fe doping into the TiO 2 lattice and improves the porosity and specific surface area.As a result of the Fe doping, the bandgaps of Fe-TiO 2 and Fe-TiO 2 -500 were about 2.75 eV and 2.42 eV, respectively.Fe-TiO 2 -500 shows excellent photocatalytic activity due to its special structure, high BET surface area and porosity.The yield of CH 4 is about 7.73 mol g -1 after loading of Pt within 12 h of reaction time under visible light illumination ( 420 nm).

light source.source: At last, the Fe-TiO 2 -500 octahedra show excellent photocatalytic activity, and the yield of CH 4 is about 7.73 mol g -1 after loading of Pt within 12 h of reaction time under visible light illumination.
light source.context: In summary, Fe 3 doped TiO 2 (Fe-TiO 2 ) octahedra were successfully prepared by a one-step hydrothermal method, using MIL-101(Fe) both as the template and the iron ion source.The formation of TiO 2 and the etching of MIL-101(Fe) occur simultaneously driven by fluorine ion.The obtained Fe-TiO 2 show uniformly Fe doping with a high specific surface area before and after the heat treatment (Fe-TiO 2 : 274 m 2 g -1 , Fe-TiO 2 -500:202 m 2 g -1 ).At last, the Fe-TiO 2 -500 octahedra show excellent photocatalytic activity, and the yield of CH 4 is about 7.73 mol g -1 after loading of Pt within 12 h of reaction time under visible light illumination.This work provides a convenient way for designing and preparing novel mental doped nanomaterials with high photocatalytic properties. operation mode.context: In summary, Fe 3 doped TiO 2 (Fe-TiO 2 ) octahedra were successfully prepared by a one-step hydrothermal method, using MIL-101(Fe) both as the template and the iron ion source.The formation of TiO 2 and the etching of MIL-101(Fe) occur simultaneously driven by fluorine ion.The obtained Fe-TiO 2 show uniformly Fe doping with a high specific surface area before and after the heat treatment (Fe-TiO 2 : 274 m 2 g -1 , Fe-TiO 2 -500:202 m 2 g -1 ).At last, the Fe-TiO 2 -500 octahedra show excellent photocatalytic activity, and the yield of CH 4 is about 7.73 mol g -1 after loading of Pt within 12 h of reaction time under visible light illumination.This work provides a convenient way for designing and preparing novel mental doped nanomaterials with high photocatalytic properties.
